page.title: 07The quarry Plympton St.Mary
page.content: The quarry is 56yrs old,having begun in 1929,and covers an area of about 10-12 acres.It is owned by{English {China Clays.}The quarried material is {Dolerite.}It is of volcanic origin and {Devon County Council}are the main purchasers.800 tons a day are taken away,after it has been processed into different categories,for various road surfaces. Fifteen men are employed,as opposed to fifty who worked there before machinery took over.Explosives are used to obtain the Dolerite and the quarry is concentric in shape,and stepped in order to avoid serious rock falls.Water is pumped out regularly. In 30yrs the quarry will treble in size.The woodland will be completely destroyed,but the company does attempt to return the land to a natural state.
